meanings.definition: A visible impression or stain on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The muddy marks on the floor showed where the dog had been.
meanings.sent2: She carefully wiped the marks off the mirror with a cloth.
meanings.sent3: The cake had marks of chocolate frosting all over it, making it look like a messy masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The old building bore marks of time with its weathered walls and faded paint.
meanings.sent5: The bright red marks on the white paper stood out like a beacon.

meanings.definition: A symbol or character used in writing or printing.
meanings.sent1: The letter 'A' is one of the marks in the English alphabet.
meanings.sent2: He made a few marks on the paper to indicate where to sign.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious marks on the ancient scroll seemed to tell a secret story.
meanings.sent4: Her smile left a mark on his heart that he couldn't forget.
meanings.sent5: The marks on the map showed the route to the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: A grade or score given for academic work.
meanings.sent1: She was proud of the high marks she received on her test.
meanings.sent2: The teacher wrote the marks in red ink at the top of the page.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him about getting low marks on the math quiz.
meanings.sent4: The marks on her report card reflected her hard work throughout the semester.
meanings.sent5: He aimed to achieve top marks in all his subjects this year.

meanings.definition: A sign or indication of something.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were marks of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: His sudden silence was a clear mark of his discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The loud laughter in the room was a mark of a joyful gathering.
meanings.sent4: The empty streets were a mark of the late hour.
meanings.sent5: The warm hug she received was a mark of their friendship.
